definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: That is no doubt true for the backstreet forgers around MacArthur Park.
sentences.chinese: 麦克阿瑟地区的伪造者也会因此而无法伪造。

sentences.english: The counterfeiters are slowly figuring out that we are catching their mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 伪造者也渐渐明白我们察觉了他们的错误。

sentences.english: The new technologies used by counterfeiters have thrown out a challenge to law enforcement.
sentences.chinese: 伪造者使用的新技术给执法者带来挑战。

sentences.english: The faker of the shroud had to be a heretic.
sentences.chinese: 裹尸布的耶稣遗像伪造者必定是个异教徒。

definition: to copy/to produce sth after a model/to counterfeit
to counterfeit/to falsify/to cheat/to defraud/fraudulent/to behave affectedly
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
to counterfeit/to pass off a fake as genuine
